message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with learning visual classifiers from text descriptions, which involves computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.CL (Computation and Language) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes a learning framework that connects text terms to relevant parts and suppresses connections to non-visual text terms, which involves machine learning (ML) techniques such as feature selection and dimensionality reduction. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with zero-shot recognition, which involves information retrieval (IR) techniques. Therefore, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is also a likely sub-category.
